Thanks,
Ruth.

Created an attachment (id=45790)
log and sumptom calatog

log and sumptom calatog

Hi Praful,

I cannot reproduce this with the TPTP 0619 driver while using Cloudscape instead of DB2. I used Cloudscape because TPTP doesn't support DB2. These are the steps that I ran; please let me know if you're doing any steps that are different to reproduce this.

A. Import symptom database
   1. File > Import > Profiling and Logging > Symptom Database File
   2. On the "Import Symptom Database File" page, I chose the following options:
        Local host (point to the file that you attached)
        Import using: IBM WebSphere proprietary format importer
        Target format: Symptom 0.1
        Accept other default values on the page. 
   3. Click Finish
B. Import the log file
   1. File > Import > Profiling and Logging > Log File
   2. Add Apache HTTP Server access log (point to the file that you attached).
   3. Click OK and then Finish.
C. Analyze
   1. Right click in the Log View
   2. Select "Analyze All" > "Run"
The Symptom Analysis Results View appears with no records in it. The Error Log does not have an exception stack trace like what you saw (it has some irrelevant messages about uninstalled/not found bundles).

Can you suggest what else I can do to reproduce the problem that you saw?

Thanks,
Ruth.
Moving target to 4.2.1 to indicate that investigation is being done to see if this bugzilla can be done in 4.2.1.

Update on the new exception. This is after fix for 
CBEExtendedDataElement added in the TPTP code.

Returning as WORKSFORME because I can't reproduce this problem. Perhaps the fix for bugzilla 148850 or some other fix also fixed this problem. As per our email, Praful will reopen this bugzilla if he sees this problem happen again.

Tested with AC-4.2.0-200608251135 and TPTP xpath patch.
